          strsplit(split = ".", fixed = TRUE) |> # split string at decimal place

                    		
                  

                  

                    107
                    12x
                    
                      
          unlist() %>%

                    		
                  

                  

                    108
                    12x
                    
                      
          `[`(2) %>% # get the string after the period

                    		
                  

                  

                    109
                    6x
                    
                      
          {ifelse(is.na(.), 0L, nchar(.))} # styler: off

                    		
                  

                  

                    110
                    
                    
                      
      )

                    		
                  

                  

                    111
                    12x
                    
                      
    width <- nchar(x) - endsWith(x, "%")

                    		
                  

                  

                    112
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    113
                    12x
                    
                      
    return(label_round(digits = decimal_n, scale = scale, width = width))

                    		
                  

                  

                    114
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    115
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    116
                    
                    
                      
  # if the above conditions are not met, return an error -----------------------

                    		
                  

                  

                    117
                    2x
                    
                      
  if (!missing(variable) && !missing(stat_name)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    118
                    1x
                    
                      
    error_message <-

                    		
                  

                  

                    119
                    1x
                    
                      
      c("The value in {.arg fmt_fun} cannot be converted into a function for

                    		
                  

                  

                    120
                    1x
                    
                      
         statistic {.val {stat_name}} and variable {.val {variable}}.",

                    		
                  

                  

                    121
                    1x
                    
                      
        "i" = "Value must be a function, a non-negative integer, or a formatting string, e.g. {.val xx.x}.",

                    		
                  

                  

                    122
                    1x
                    
                      
        "*" = "See {.help cards::alias_as_fmt_fun} for details."

                    		
                  

                  

                    123
                    
                    
                      
      )

                    		
                  

                  

                    124
                    
                    
                      
  } else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    125
                    1x
                    
                      
    error_message <-

                    		
                  

                  

                    126
                    1x
                    
                      
      c("The value in {.arg fmt_fun} cannot be converted into a function.",

                    		
                  

                  

                    127
                    1x
                    
                      
        "i" = "Value must be a function, a non-negative integer, or a formatting string, e.g. {.val xx.x}.",

                    		
                  

                  

                    128
                    1x
                    
                      
        "*" = "See {.help cards::alias_as_fmt_fun} for details."

                    		
                  

                  

                    129
                    
                    
                      
      )

                    		
                  

                  

                    130
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    131
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    132
                    2x
                    
                      
  cli::cli_abort(

                    		
                  

                  

                    133
                    2x
                    
                      
    message = error_message,

                    		
                  

                  

                    134
                    2x
                    
                      
    call = get_cli_abort_call()

                    		
                  

                  

                    135
                    
                    
                      
  )

                    		
                  

                  

                    136
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    137
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    138
                    
                    
                      
#' Generate Formatting Function

                    		
                  

                  

                    139
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    140
                    
                    
                      
#' Returns a function with the requested rounding and scaling schema.

                    		
                  

                  

                    141
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    142
                    
                    
                      
#' @param digits (`integer`)\cr

                    		
                  

                  

                    143
                    
                    
                      
#'   a non-negative integer specifying the number of decimal places

                    		
                  

                  

                    144
                    
                    
                      
#'   round statistics to

                    		
                  

                  

                    145
                    
                    
                      
#' @param scale (`numeric`)\cr

                    		
                  

                  

                    146
                    
                    
                      
#'   a scalar real number. Before rounding, the input will be scaled by

                    		
                  

                  

                    147
                    
                    
                      
#'   this quantity

                    		
                  

                  

                    148
                    
                    
                      
#' @param width (`integer`)\cr

                    		
                  

                  

                    149
                    
                    
                      
#'   a non-negative integer specifying the minimum width of the

                    		
                  

                  

                    150
                    
                    
                      
#'   returned formatted values

                    		
                  

                  

                    151
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    152
                    
                    
                      
#' @return a function

                    		
                  

                  

                    153
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    154
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    155
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    156
                    
                    
                      
#' label_round(2)(pi)

                    		
                  

                  

                    157
                    
                    
                      
#' label_round(1, scale = 100)(pi)

                    		
                  

                  

                    158
                    
                    
                      
#' label_round(2, width = 5)(pi)

                    		
                  

                  

                    159
                    
                    
                      
label_round <- function(digits = 1, scale = 1, width = NULL) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    160
                    17588x
                    
                      
  round_fun <- .get_round_fun()

                    		
                  

                  

                    161
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    162
                    17587x
                    
                      
  function(x) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    163
                    
                    
                      
    # round and scale vector

                    		
                  

                  

                    164
                    124x
                    
                      
    res <-

                    		
                  

                  

                    165
                    124x
                    
                      
      ifelse(

                    		
                  

                  

                    166
                    124x
                    
                      
        is.na(x),

                    		
                  

                  

                    167
                    124x
                    
                      
        NA_character_,

                    		
                  

                  

                    168
                    124x
                    
                      
        format(round_fun(x * scale, digits = digits), nsmall = digits) |> str_trim()

                    		
                  

                  

                    169
                    
                    
                      
      )

                    		
                  

                  

                    170
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    171
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    172
                    
                    
                      
    # if width provided, pad formatted result

                    		
                  

                  

                    173
                    124x
                    
                      
    if (!is.null(width)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    174
                    14x
                    
                      
      res <-

                    		
                  

                  

                    175
                    14x
                    
                      
        ifelse(

                    		
                  

                  

                    176
                    14x
                    
                      
          nchar(res) >= width | is.na(res),

                    		
                  

                  

                    177
                    14x
                    
                      
          res,

                    		
                  

                  

                    178
                    14x
                    
                      
          paste0(strrep(" ", width - nchar(res)), res)

                    		
                  

                  

                    179
                    
                    
                      
        )

                    		
                  

                  

                    180
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    181
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    182
                    
                    
                      
    # return final formatted vector

                    		
                  

                  

                    183
                    124x
                    
                      
    res

                    		
                  

                  

                    184
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    185
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    186
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    187
                    
                    
                      
.get_round_fun <- function() {

                    		
                  

                  

                    188
                    17588x
                    
                      
  switch(getOption("cards.round_type", default = "round-half-up"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    189
                    17588x
                    
                      
    "round-half-up" = round5,

                    		
                  

                  

                    190
                    17588x
                    
                      
    "round-to-even" = round

                    		
                  

                  

                    191
                    
                    
                      
  ) %||%

                    		
                  

                  

                    192
                    17588x
                    
                      
    cli::cli_abort(

                    		
                  

                  

                    193
                    17588x
                    
                      
      "The {.arg cards.round_type} {.emph option} must be one of

                    		
                  

                  

                    194
                    17588x
                    
                      
         {.val {c('round-half-up', 'round-to-even')}}.",

                    		
                  

                  

                    195
                    17588x
                    
                      
      call = get_cli_abort_call()

                    		
                  

                  

                    196
                    
                    
                      
    )

                    		
                  

                  

                    197
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    198
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    199
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    200
                    
                    
                      
#' Check 'xx' Format Structure

                    		
                  

                  

                    201
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    202
                    
                    
                      
#' @description

                    		
                  

                  

                    203
                    
                    
                      
#' A function that checks a **single** string for consistency.

                    		
                  

                  

                    204
                    
                    
                      
#' String must begin with 'x' and only consist of x's, a single period or none,

                    		
                  

                  

                    205
                    
                    
                      
#' and may end with a percent symbol.

                    		
                  

                  

                    206
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    207
                    
                    
                      
#' If string is consistent, `TRUE` is returned. Otherwise an error.

                    		
                  

                  

                    208
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    209
                    
                    
                      
#' @param x (`string`)\cr

                    		
                  

                  

                    210
                    
                    
                      
#'   string to check

                    		
                  

                  

                    211
                    
                    
                      
#' @param variable (`character`)\cr the variable whose statistic is to be formatted

                    		
                  

                  

                    212
                    
                    
                      
#' @param stat_name (`character`)\cr the name of the statistic that is to be formatted

                    		
                  

                  

                    213
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    214
                    
                    
                      
#' @return a logical

                    		
                  

                  

                    215
                    
                    
                      
#' @keywords internal

                    		
                  

                  

                    216
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    217
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    218
                    
                    
                      
#' cards:::.check_fmt_string("xx.x") # TRUE

                    		
                  

                  

                    219
                    
                    
                      
#' cards:::.check_fmt_string("xx.x%") # TRUE

                    		
                  

                  

                    220
                    
                    
                      
.check_fmt_string <- function(x, variable, stat_name) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    221
                    13x
                    
                      
  set_cli_abort_call()

                    		
                  

                  

                    222
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    223
                    
                    
                      
  # perform checks on the string

                    		
                  

                  

                    224
                    13x
                    
                      
  fmt_is_good <-

                    		
                  

                  

                    225
                    13x
                    
                      
    grepl("^x[x.%]+$", x = x) && # string begins with 'x', and consists of only x, period, or percent

                    		
                  

                  

                    226
                    13x
                    
                      
      sum(unlist(gregexpr("\\.", x)) != -1) %in% c(0L, 1L) && # a period appears 0 or 1 times

                    		
                  

                  

                    227
                    13x
                    
                      
      sum(unlist(gregexpr("%", x)) != -1) %in% c(0L, 1L) && # a percent appears 0 or 1 times

                    		
                  

                  

                    228
                    13x
                    
                      
      (sum(unlist(gregexpr("%", x)) != -1) %in% 0L || grepl(pattern = "%$", x = x)) # if there is a % it appears at the end

                    		
                  

                  

                    229
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    230
                    13x
                    
                      
  if (isFALSE(fmt_is_good)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    231
                    1x
                    
                      
    cli::cli_abort(

                    		
                  

                  

                    232
                    1x
                    
                      
      message =

                    		
                  

                  

                    233
                    1x
                    
                      
        "The format {.val {x}} for `fmt_fun` is not valid for the

                    		
                  

                  

                    234
                    1x
                    
                      
         variable {.val {variable}} for the statistic {.val {stat_name}}.

                    		
                  

                  

                    235
                    1x
                    
                      
         String must begin with 'x' and only consist of x's, a single period or

                    		
                  

                  

                    236
                    1x
                    
                      
         none, and may end with a percent symbol.",

                    		
                  

                  

                    237
                    1x
                    
                      
      call = get_cli_abort_call()

                    		
                  

                  

                    238
                    
                    
                      
    )

                    		
                  

                  

                    239
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    240
                    12x
                    
                      
  fmt_is_good

                    		
                  

                  

                    241
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Standard Order of ARD

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' @description

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' ARD functions for relocating columns and rows to the standard order.

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' - `tidy_ard_column_order()` relocates columns of the ARD to the standard order.

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' - `tidy_ard_row_order()` orders rows of ARD according to groups and

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#'   strata (group 1, then group2, etc), while retaining the column order of the input ARD.

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' @param x (`data.frame`)\cr

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#'   an ARD data frame of class 'card'

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' @param group_order (`string`)\cr

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#'   specifies the ordering of the grouping variables.

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#'   Must be one of `c("ascending", "descending")`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#'   Default is `"ascending"`, where grouping variables begin with `"group1"` variables,

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#'   followed by `"group2"` variables, etc.

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' @return an ARD data frame of class 'card'

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' @name tidy_ard_order

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' # order columns

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' ard <-

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#'   dplyr::bind_rows(

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#'     ard_continuous(mtcars, variables = "mpg"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#'     ard_continuous(mtcars, variables = "mpg", by = "cyl")

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#'   )

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#' tidy_ard_column_order(ard) |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#'   tidy_ard_row_order()

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
NULL

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#' @rdname tidy_ard_order

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
tidy_ard_column_order <- function(x, group_order = c("ascending", "descending")) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    1346x
                    
                      
  set_cli_abort_call()

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    1346x
                    
                      
  group_order <- arg_match(group_order)

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
  # specify the ordering the grouping variables

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    1346x
                    
                      
  group_cols <-

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    1346x
                    
                      
    data.frame(colname = dplyr::select(x, all_ard_groups()) |> names()) |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    1346x
                    
                      
    dplyr::arrange(

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    1346x
                    
                      
      case_switch(

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    1346x
                    
                      
        group_order == "ascending" ~ as.integer(unlist(str_extract_all(.data$colname, "\\d+"))),

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    1346x
                    
                      
        group_order == "descending" ~ dplyr::desc(as.integer(unlist(str_extract_all(.data$colname, "\\d+"))))

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      
      ),

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    1346x
                    
                      
      .data$colname

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      
    ) |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    1346x
                    
                      
    dplyr::pull("colname")

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    
                    
                      
  # selecting the columns in the tidy order

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    1346x
                    
                      
  dplyr::select(

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    1346x
                    
                      
    x,

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    1346x
                    
                      
    all_of(group_cols),

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    1346x
                    
                      
    all_ard_variables(),

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    1346x
                    
                      
    any_of(c(

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    1346x
                    
                      
      "context",

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    1346x
                    
                      
      "stat_name", "stat_label", "stat", "stat_fmt", "fmt_fun",

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    1346x
                    
                      
      "warning", "error"

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    
                    
                      
    )),

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    1346x
                    
                      
    dplyr::everything()

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      
  )

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    
                    
                      
#' @rdname tidy_ard_order

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    
                    
                      
tidy_ard_row_order <- function(x) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    738x
                    
                      
  set_cli_abort_call()

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    
                    
                      
  # get columns that dictate ordering

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    738x
                    
                      
  cols <- x |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    738x
                    
                      
    dplyr::select(all_ard_groups(c("names", "levels"))) |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    738x
                    
                      
    names()

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    738x
                    
                      
  if (!is_empty(cols)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    517x
                    
                      
    max_group_n <- as.integer(unlist(str_extract_all(cols, "\\d+"))) |> max()

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    517x
                    
                      
    cols <-

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    517x
                    
                      
      map(seq_len(max_group_n), ~ c(paste0("group", .x), paste0("group", .x, "_level"))) |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    517x
                    
                      
      unlist() |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    517x
                    
                      
      intersect(cols)

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    
                    
                      
  # perform the ordering

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    738x
                    
                      
  x |> dplyr::arrange(across(all_of(cols), .fns = function(x) match(x, unique(x))))

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Bind ARDs

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' Wrapper for `dplyr::bind_rows()` with additional checks

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' for duplicated statistics.

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' @param ... ([`dynamic-dots`][rlang::dyn-dots])\cr

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#'   ARDs to combine. Each argument can either be an ARD,

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#'   or a list of ARDs. Columns are matched by name, and any missing

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#'   columns will be filled with `NA`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' @param .distinct (`logical`)\cr

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#'   logical indicating whether to remove non-distinct values from the ARD.

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#'   Duplicates are checked across grouping variables, primary variables,

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#'   context (if present), the **statistic name and the statistic value**.

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#'   Default is `FALSE`. If a statistic name and value is repeated and `.distinct=TRUE`,

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#'   the more recently added statistics will be retained, and the other(s) omitted.

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' @param .update (`logical`)\cr

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#'   logical indicating whether to update ARD and remove duplicated named statistics.

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#'   Duplicates are checked across grouping variables, primary variables, and the

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#'   **statistic name**.

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#'   Default is `FALSE`. If a statistic name is repeated and `.update=TRUE`,

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#'   the more recently added statistics will be retained, and the other(s) omitted.

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' @param .order (`logical`)\cr

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#'   logical indicating whether to order the rows of the stacked ARDs, allowing

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#'   statistics that share common group and variable values to appear in

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#'   consecutive rows. Default is `FALSE`. Ordering will be based on the order

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#'   of the group/variable values prior to stacking.

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' @param .quiet (`logical`)\cr

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#'   logical indicating whether to suppress any messaging. Default is `FALSE`

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#' @return an ARD data frame of class 'card'

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#' ard <- ard_categorical(ADSL, by = "ARM", variables = "AGEGR1")

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
#' bind_ard(ard, ard, .update = TRUE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
bind_ard <- function(..., .distinct = TRUE, .update = FALSE, .order = FALSE, .quiet = FALSE) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    51x
                    
                      
  set_cli_abort_call()

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
  # check inputs ---------------------------------------------------------------

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    51x
                    
                      
  check_scalar_logical(.distinct)

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    51x
                    
                      
  check_scalar_logical(.update)

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    50x
                    
                      
  check_scalar_logical(.order)

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    50x
                    
                      
  check_scalar_logical(.quiet)

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
  # stack ARDs -----------------------------------------------------------------

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    50x
                    
                      
  data <- dplyr::bind_rows(...)

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      
  # check for non-distinct statistics ------------------------------------------

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    50x
                    
                      
  not_distinct <-

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    50x
                    
                      
    dplyr::select(data, all_ard_groups(), all_ard_variables(), any_of("context"), "stat_name", "stat")[seq(nrow(data), 1L), ] |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    50x
                    
                      
    duplicated()

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    50x
                    
                      
  if (any(not_distinct) && isTRUE(.distinct)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    3x
                    
                      
    if (isFALSE(.quiet)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    2x
                    
                      
      cli::cli_inform(c(

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    2x
                    
                      
        "i" = "{sum(not_distinct)} row{?s} with {.emph duplicated statistic values} {?has/have} been removed.",

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    2x
                    
                      
        "*" = "See {.help [cards::bind_ard(.distinct)](cards::bind_ard)} for details."

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      
      ))

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    3x
                    
                      
    data <-

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    3x
                    
                      
      dplyr::filter(

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    3x
                    
                      
        data,

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    3x
                    
                      
        .by = c(all_ard_groups(), all_ard_variables(), "stat_name"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    3x
                    
                      
        dplyr::row_number() == dplyr::n()

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    
                    
                      
      )

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    
                    
                      
  # check for duplicate stat_name ----------------------------------------------

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    50x
                    
                      
  dupes <-

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    50x
                    
                      
    dplyr::select(data, all_ard_groups(), all_ard_variables(), "stat_name")[seq(nrow(data), 1L), ] |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    50x
                    
                      
    duplicated()

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    50x
                    
                      
  if (any(dupes) && isTRUE(.update)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    !
                    
                      
    if (isFALSE(.quiet)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    !
                    
                      
      cli::cli_inform(c(

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    !
                    
                      
        "i" = "{sum(dupes)} row{?s} with {.emph duplicated statistic names} {?has/have} been removed.",

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    !
                    
                      
        "*" = "See {.help [cards::bind_ard(.update)](cards::bind_ard)} for details."

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    
                    
                      
      ))

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    !
                    
                      
    data <-

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    !
                    
                      
      dplyr::filter(

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    !
                    
                      
        data,

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    !
                    
                      
        .by = c(all_ard_groups(), all_ard_variables(), "stat_name"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    !
                    
                      
        dplyr::row_number() == dplyr::n()

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    
                    
                      
      )

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    50x
                    
                      
  } else if (any(dupes) && isFALSE(.update)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    1x
                    
                      
    cli::cli_abort(

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    1x
                    
                      
      c(

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    1x
                    
                      
        "!" = "{sum(dupes)} row{?s} with {.emph duplicated statistic names} {?has/have} been found.",

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    1x
                    
                      
        "i" = "See {.help [cards::bind_ard(.update)](cards::bind_ard)} for details."

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    
                    
                      
      ),

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    1x
                    
                      
      call = get_cli_abort_call()

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    
                    
                      
    )

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    
                    
                      
  # optionally reorder ---------------------------------------------------------

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    49x
                    
                      
  if (isTRUE(.order)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    7x
                    
                      
    data <- tidy_ard_row_order(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    99
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    100
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    101
                    
                    
                      
  # return stacked ARDs --------------------------------------------------------

                    		
                  

                  

                    102
                    49x
                    
                      
  tidy_ard_column_order(data) |> as_card()

                    		
                  

                  

                    103
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Summary Functions

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' @description

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' - `continuous_summary_fns()` returns a named list of summary functions

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#'   for continuous variables. Some functions include slight modifications to

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#'   their base equivalents. For example, the `min()` and `max()` functions

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#'   return `NA` instead of `Inf` when an empty vector is passed.

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#'   Statistics `"p25"` and `"p75"` are calculated with `quantile(type = 2)`,

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#'   which matches

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#'   [SAS's default value](https://psiaims.github.io/CAMIS/Comp/r-sas-summary-stats.html).

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' @param summaries (`character`)\cr

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#'   a character vector of results to include in output. Select one or more from

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#'     `r eval(formals(continuous_summary_fns)$summaries) %>% {paste(shQuote(., "sh"), collapse = ", ")}`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' @param other_stats (named `list`)\cr

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#'   named list of other statistic functions to supplement the pre-programmed functions.

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' @return named list of summary statistics

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' @name summary_functions

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' # continuous variable summaries

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' ard_continuous(

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#'   ADSL,

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#'   variables = "AGE",

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#'   statistic = ~ continuous_summary_fns(c("N", "median"))

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' )

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
NULL

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#' @rdname summary_functions

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
continuous_summary_fns <- function(summaries = c(

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
                                     "N", "mean", "sd", "median",

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
                                     "p25", "p75", "min", "max"

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
                                   ),

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
                                   other_stats = NULL) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    175x
                    
                      
  set_cli_abort_call()

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
  # process the selection of the summary stats to include ----------------------

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    175x
                    
                      
  summaries <- arg_match(summaries, multiple = TRUE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
  # list all functions available by default ------------------------------------

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    175x
                    
                      
  list_fns <-

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    175x
                    
                      
    list(

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    175x
                    
                      
      N = function(x) length(x),

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    175x
                    
                      
      mean = function(x) mean(x, na.rm = TRUE),

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    175x
                    
                      
      sd = function(x) stats::sd(x, na.rm = TRUE),

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    175x
                    
                      
      median = function(x) stats::median(x, na.rm = TRUE),

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    175x
                    
                      
      p25 = function(x) stats::quantile(x, probs = 0.25, na.rm = TRUE, type = 2) |> unname(),

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    175x
                    
                      
      p75 = function(x) stats::quantile(x, probs = 0.75, na.rm = TRUE, type = 2) |> unname(),

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    175x
                    
                      
      min = function(x) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    1251x
                    
                      
        if (length(x) == 0L) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    1x
                    
                      
          return(structure(NA, class = class(x)))

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      
        }

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    1250x
                    
                      
        min(x, na.rm = TRUE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      
      },

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    175x
                    
                      
      max = function(x) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    1250x
                    
                      
        if (length(x) == 0L) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    !
                    
                      
          return(structure(NA, class = class(x)))

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    
                    
                      
        }

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    1250x
                    
                      
        max(x, na.rm = TRUE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      
      }

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      
    )

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    
                    
                      
  # return list of functions ---------------------------------------------------

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    175x
                    
                      
  list_fns[summaries] |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    175x
                    
                      
    c(other_stats)

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Process tidyselectors

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' @description

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' Functions process tidyselect arguments passed to functions in the cards package.

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' The processed values are saved to the calling environment, by default.

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#' - `process_selectors()`: the arguments will be processed with tidyselect and

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#'   converted to a vector of character column names.

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' - `process_formula_selectors()`: for arguments that expect named lists or

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#'   lists of formulas (where the LHS of the formula is a tidyselector). This

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#'   function processes these inputs and returns a named list. If a name is

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#'   repeated, the last entry is kept.

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' - `fill_formula_selectors()`: when users override the default argument values,

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#'   it can be important to ensure that each column from a data frame is assigned

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#'   a value. This function checks that each column in `data` has an assigned

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#'   value, and if not, fills the value in with the default value passed here.

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' - `compute_formula_selector()`: used in `process_formula_selectors()` to

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#'   evaluate a single argument.

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' - `check_list_elements()`: used to check the class/type/values of the list

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#'   elements, primarily those processed with `process_formula_selectors()`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' - `cards_select()`: wraps `tidyselect::eval_select() |> names()`, and returns

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#'   better contextual messaging when errors occur.

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
