                    9
                    
                    
                      
#'   scalar to fill NULL values with before unlisting (if they are present).

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#'   Default is `NA`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' @param fct_as_chr (scalar `logical`)\cr

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#'   When `TRUE`, factor elements will be converted to character before unlisting.

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#'   When the column being unlisted contains mixed types of classes, the

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#'   factor elements are often converted to the underlying integer value instead

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#'   of retaining the label. Default is `TRUE`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' @returns a data frame

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' ADSL |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#'   ard_categorical(by = ARM, variables = AGEGR1) |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#'   apply_fmt_fun() |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#'   unlist_ard_columns()

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' ADSL |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#'   ard_continuous(by = ARM, variables = AGE) |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#'   apply_fmt_fun() |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#'   unlist_ard_columns()

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
unlist_ard_columns <- function(x,

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
                               columns = c(where(is.list), -any_of(c("warning", "error", "fmt_fun"))),

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
                               fill = NA,

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
                               fct_as_chr = TRUE) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
  # check inputs ---------------------------------------------------------------

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    25x
                    
                      
  set_cli_abort_call()

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    25x
                    
                      
  check_data_frame(x)

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    25x
                    
                      
  process_selectors(x, columns = {{ columns }})

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    25x
                    
                      
  check_scalar(fill)

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    25x
                    
                      
  check_scalar_logical(fct_as_chr)

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
  # first replace any NULL values with the fill value --------------------------

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    25x
                    
                      
  if (isTRUE(fct_as_chr)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    24x
                    
                      
    x <- x |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    24x
                    
                      
      dplyr::mutate(

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    24x
                    
                      
        across(

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    24x
                    
                      
          all_of(columns),

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    24x
                    
                      
          ~ map(., \(value) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    33x
                    
                      
            if (inherits(value, "factor")) value <- as.character(value) # styler: off

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    5814x
                    
                      
            value %||% .env$fill

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      
          })

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    
                    
                      
        )

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      
      )

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      
  } else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    1x
                    
                      
    x <- x |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    1x
                    
                      
      dplyr::mutate(

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    1x
                    
                      
        across(all_of(columns), ~ map(., \(value) value %||% .env$fill))

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      
      )

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      
  # unlist the columns ---------------------------------------------------------

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    25x
                    
                      
  for (var in columns) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    82x
                    
                      
    var_unlisted <- unlist(x[[var]])

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    82x
                    
                      
    if (length(var_unlisted) != length(x[[var]])) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    1x
                    
                      
      cli::cli_inform("Cannot unlist column {.val {var}}.")

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    1x
                    
                      
      next

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    81x
                    
                      
    x[[var]] <- var_unlisted

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    
                    
                      
  # return unlisted object -----------------------------------------------------

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    25x
                    
                      
  x

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' ARD Nesting

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' @description

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' This function is similar to [tidyr::nest()], except that it retains

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' rows for unobserved combinations (and unobserved factor levels) of by

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' variables, and unobserved combinations of stratifying variables.

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' The levels are wrapped in lists so they can be stacked with other types

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' of different classes.

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' @param data (`data.frame`)\cr

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#'   a data frame

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' @param by,strata (`character`)\cr

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#'   columns to nest by/stratify by. Arguments are similar,

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#'   but with an important distinction:

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#'   `by`: data frame is nested by **all combinations** of the columns specified,

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#'   including unobserved combinations and unobserved factor levels.

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#'   `strata`: data frame is nested by **all _observed_ combinations** of the

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#'   columns specified.

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#'   Arguments may be used in conjunction with one another.

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' @param key (`string`)\cr

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#'   the name of the new column with the nested data frame. Default is `"data"`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' @param rename_columns (`logical`)\cr

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#'   logical indicating whether to rename the `by` and `strata` variables.

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#'   Default is `TRUE`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' @param list_columns (`logical`)\cr

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#'   logical indicating whether to put levels of `by` and

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#'   `strata` columns in a list. Default is `TRUE`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#' @param include_data (scalar `logical`)\cr

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#'   logical indicating whether to include the data subsets as a list-column.

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#'   Default is `TRUE`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
#' @return a nested tibble

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
#' nest_for_ard(

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
#'   data =

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
#'     ADAE |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      
#'       dplyr::left_join(ADSL[c("USUBJID", "ARM")], by = "USUBJID") |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
#'       dplyr::filter(AOCCSFL %in% "Y"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
#'   by = "ARM",

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
#'   strata = "AESOC"

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      
#' )

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      
nest_for_ard <- function(data, by = NULL, strata = NULL, key = "data",

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      
                         rename_columns = TRUE, list_columns = TRUE,

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      
                         include_data = TRUE) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    227x
                    
                      
  set_cli_abort_call()

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      
  # if no by/stratifying variables, simply return the data frame

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    227x
                    
                      
  if (is_empty(by) && is_empty(strata)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    86x
                    
                      
    return((dplyr::tibble("{key}" := list(data))))

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    141x
                    
                      
  n_missing <- nrow(data) - nrow(tidyr::drop_na(data, all_of(by), all_of(strata)))

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    141x
                    
                      
  if (n_missing > 0L) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    !
                    
                      
    cli::cli_inform("{n_missing} missing observation{?s} in the {.val {c(by, strata)}} column{?s} have been removed.")

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      
  # create nested strata data --------------------------------------------------

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    141x
                    
                      
  if (!is_empty(strata)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    3x
                    
                      
    df_strata <-

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    3x
                    
                      
      data[strata] |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    3x
                    
                      
      tidyr::drop_na() |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    3x
                    
                      
      dplyr::distinct() |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    3x
                    
                      
      dplyr::arrange(across(all_of(strata)))

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    
                    
                      
  # create nested by data --------------------------------------------------

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    141x
                    
                      
  if (!is_empty(by)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    
                    
                      
    # get a named list of all unique values for each by variable (including unobserved levels)

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    139x
                    
                      
    lst_unique_vals <-

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    139x
                    
                      
      by |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    139x
                    
                      
      lapply(FUN = function(x) data[[x]] |> .unique_and_sorted()) |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    139x
                    
                      
      stats::setNames(nm = by)

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    
                    
                      
    # convert that list to a data frame with one row per unique combination

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    139x
                    
                      
    df_by <- tidyr::expand_grid(!!!lst_unique_vals)

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    
                    
                      
  # combining by and strata data sets into one, as needed ----------------------

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    141x
                    
                      
  if (!is_empty(by) && is_empty(strata)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    138x
                    
                      
    df_return <- df_by

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    3x
                    
                      
  } else if (is_empty(by) && !is_empty(strata)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    2x
                    
                      
    df_return <- df_strata

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    1x
                    
                      
  } else if (!is_empty(by) && !is_empty(strata)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    1x
                    
                      
    df_return <-

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    1x
                    
                      
      df_strata |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    1x
                    
                      
      dplyr::mutate(

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    1x
                    
                      
        "{key}" := list(df_by),

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    1x
                    
                      
        .before = 0L

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    
                    
                      
      ) |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    1x
                    
                      
      tidyr::unnest(cols = all_of(key))

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    99
                    
                    
                      
  # we will now add a column to the df_return data frame of the subsetted data

                    		
                  

                  

                    100
                    
                    
                      
  #   to do so, we'll construct a list of expressions that can be passed to

                    		
                  

                  

                    101
                    
                    
                      
  #   dplyr::filter() to subset the data frame

                    		
                  

                  

                    102
                    141x
                    
                      
  if (isTRUE(include_data)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    103
                    140x
                    
                      
    lst_filter_exprs <-

                    		
                  

                  

                    104
                    140x
                    
                      
      seq_len(nrow(df_return)) |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    105
                    140x
                    
                      
      lapply(

                    		
                  

                  

                    106
                    140x
                    
                      
        FUN = function(i) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    107
                    817x
                    
                      
          lapply(

                    		
                  

                  

                    108
                    817x
                    
                      
            X = c(by, strata),

                    		
                  

                  

                    109
                    817x
                    
                      
            FUN = function(z) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    110
                    941x
                    
                      
              expr(!!data_sym(z) %in% df_return[[!!z]][!!i])

                    		
                  

                  

                    111
                    
                    
                      
            }

                    		
                  

                  

                    112
                    
                    
                      
          )

                    		
                  

                  

                    113
                    
                    
                      
        }

                    		
                  

                  

                    114
                    
                    
                      
      )

                    		
                  

                  

                    115
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    116
                    
                    
                      
    # now adding the subsetted data frames to the nested tibble

                    		
                  

                  

                    117
                    140x
                    
                      
    df_return[[key]] <-

                    		
                  

                  

                    118
                    140x
                    
                      
      lapply(

                    		
                  

                  

                    119
                    140x
                    
                      
        seq_len(nrow(df_return)),

                    		
                  

                  

                    120
                    140x
                    
                      
        FUN = function(i) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    121
                    817x
                    
                      
          dplyr::filter(data, !!!lst_filter_exprs[[i]]) |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    122
                    817x
                    
                      
            dplyr::select(-all_of(.env$by), -all_of(.env$strata))

                    		
                  

                  

                    123
                    
                    
                      
        }

                    		
                  

                  

                    124
                    
                    
                      
      )

                    		
                  

                  

                    125
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    126
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    127
                    
                    
                      
  # put variable levels in list to preserve types when stacked -----------------

                    		
                  

                  

                    128
                    141x
                    
                      
  if (isTRUE(list_columns)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    129
                    141x
                    
                      
    df_return <-

                    		
                  

                  

                    130
                    141x
                    
                      
      df_return |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    131
                    141x
                    
                      
      dplyr::mutate(across(.cols = -any_of(key), .fns = as.list))

                    		
                  

                  

                    132
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    133
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    134
                    
                    
                      
  # rename by and strata columns to group## and group##_level ------------------

                    		
                  

                  

                    135
                    141x
                    
                      
  if (isTRUE(rename_columns)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    136
                    141x
                    
                      
    df_return <-

                    		
                  

                  

                    137
                    141x
                    
                      
      df_return |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    138
                    141x
                    
                      
      .nesting_rename_ard_columns(by = by, strata = strata)

                    		
                  

                  

                    139
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    140
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    141
                    
                    
                      
  # returning final nested tibble ----------------------------------------------

                    		
                  

                  

                    142
                    141x
                    
                      
  df_return |> dplyr::as_tibble()

                    		
                  

                  

                    143
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    144
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    145
                    
                    
                      
#' Rename ARD Columns

                    		
                  

                  

                    146
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    147
                    
                    
                      
#' If `variable` is provided, adds the standard `variable` column to `x`. If `by`/`strata` are

                    		
                  

                  

                    148
                    
                    
                      
#' provided, adds the standard `group##` column(s) to `x` and renames the provided columns to

                    		
                  

                  

                    149
                    
                    
                      
#' `group##_level` in `x`, where `##` is determined by the column's position in `c(by, strata)`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    150
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    151
                    
                    
                      
#' @param x (`data.frame`)\cr

                    		
                  

                  

                    152
                    
                    
                      
#'   a data frame

                    		
                  

                  

                    153
                    
                    
                      
#' @param variable (`character`)\cr

                    		
                  

                  

                    154
                    
                    
                      
#'   name of `variable` column in `x`. Default is `NULL`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    155
                    
                    
                      
#' @param by (`character`)\cr

                    		
                  

                  

                    156
                    
                    
                      
#'   character vector of names of `by` columns in `x`. Default is `NULL`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    157
                    
                    
                      
#' @param strata (`character`)\cr

                    		
                  

                  

                    158
                    
                    
                      
#'   character vector of names of `strata` columns in `x`. Default is `NULL`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    159
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    160
                    
                    
                      
#' @return a tibble

                    		
                  

                  

                    161
                    
                    
                      
#' @keywords internal

                    		
                  

                  

                    162
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    163
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    164
                    
                    
                      
#' ard <- nest_for_ard(

                    		
                  

                  

                    165
                    
                    
                      
#'   data =

                    		
                  

                  

                    166
                    
                    
                      
#'     ADAE |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    167
                    
                    
                      
#'       dplyr::left_join(ADSL[c("USUBJID", "ARM")], by = "USUBJID") |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    168
                    
                    
                      
#'       dplyr::filter(AOCCSFL %in% "Y"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    169
                    
                    
                      
#'   by = "ARM",

                    		
                  

                  

                    170
                    
                    
                      
#'   strata = "AESOC",

                    		
                  

                  

                    171
                    
                    
                      
#'   rename_columns = FALSE

                    		
                  

                  

                    172
                    
                    
                      
#' )

                    		
                  

                  

                    173
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    174
                    
                    
                      
#' cards:::.nesting_rename_ard_columns(ard, by = "ARM", strata = "AESOC")

                    		
                  

                  

                    175
                    
                    
                      
.nesting_rename_ard_columns <- function(x, variable = NULL, by = NULL, strata = NULL) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    176
                    577x
                    
                      
  if (!is_empty(variable)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    177
                    436x
                    
                      
    x <-

                    		
                  

                  

                    178
                    436x
                    
                      
      x |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    179
                    436x
                    
                      
      dplyr::rename(variable_level = !!sym(variable)) |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    180
                    436x
                    
                      
      dplyr::mutate(variable = .env$variable, .before = 0L)

                    		
                  

                  

                    181
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    182
                    577x
                    
                      
  if (!is_empty(by) || !is_empty(strata)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    183
                    455x
                    
                      
    x <-

                    		
                  

                  

                    184
                    455x
                    
                      
      x |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    185
                    455x
                    
                      
      dplyr::mutate(!!!(as.list(c(by, strata)) |> stats::setNames(paste0("group", seq_along(c(strata, by))))), .before = 0L) |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    186
                    455x
                    
                      
      dplyr::rename(!!!(as.list(c(by, strata)) |> stats::setNames(paste0("group", seq_along(c(strata, by)), "_level"))))

                    		
                  

                  

                    187
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    188
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    189
                    577x
                    
                      
  tidy_ard_column_order(x)

                    		
                  

                  

                    190
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Categorical ARD Statistics

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' Compute Analysis Results Data (ARD) for categorical summary statistics.

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' @param data (`data.frame`)\cr

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#'   a data frame

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#' @param by,strata ([`tidy-select`][dplyr::dplyr_tidy_select])\cr

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#'   columns to use for grouping or stratifying the table output.

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#'   Arguments are similar, but with an important distinction:

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#'   `by`: results are tabulated by **all combinations** of the columns specified,

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#'      including unobserved combinations and unobserved factor levels.

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#'   `strata`: results are tabulated by **all _observed_ combinations** of the

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#'     columns specified.

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#'   Arguments may be used in conjunction with one another.

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' @param variables ([`tidy-select`][dplyr::dplyr_tidy_select])\cr

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#'   columns to include in summaries. Default is `everything()`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' @param denominator (`string`, `data.frame`, `integer`)\cr

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#'   Specify this argument to change the denominator,

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#'   e.g. the `"N"` statistic. Default is `'column'`. See below for details.

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' @param statistic ([`formula-list-selector`][syntax])\cr

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#'   a named list, a list of formulas,

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#'   or a single formula where the list element one or more of  `c("n", "N", "p", "n_cum", "p_cum")`

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#'   (on the RHS of a formula).

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' @param stat_label ([`formula-list-selector`][syntax])\cr

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#'   a named list, a list of formulas, or a single formula where

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#'   the list element is either a named list or a list of formulas defining the

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#'   statistic labels, e.g. `everything() ~ list(n = "n", p = "pct")` or

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#'   `everything() ~ list(n ~ "n", p ~ "pct")`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams ard_continuous

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#' @section Denominators:

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#' By default, the `ard_categorical()` function returns the statistics `"n"`, `"N"`, and

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
#' `"p"`, where little `"n"` are the counts for the variable levels, and big `"N"` is

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
#' the number of non-missing observations. The calculation for the

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
#' proportion is  `p = n/N`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
#' However, it is sometimes necessary to provide a different `"N"` to use

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
#' as the denominator in this calculation. For example, in a calculation

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
#' of the rates of various observed adverse events, you may need to update the

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      
#' denominator to the number of enrolled subjects.

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
#' In such cases, use the `denominator` argument to specify a new definition

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
#' of `"N"`, and subsequently `"p"`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      
#' The argument expects one of the following inputs:

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      
#' - a string: one of `"column"`, `"row"`, or `"cell"`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      
#'     - `"column"`, the default, returns percentages where the sum is equal to

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      
#'        one within the variable after the data frame has been subset with `by`/`strata`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      
#'     - `"row"` gives 'row' percentages where `by`/`strata` columns are the 'top'

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    
                    
                      
#'        of a cross table, and the variables are the rows. This is well-defined

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      
#'        for a single `by` or `strata` variable, and care must be taken when there

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      
#'        are more to ensure the the results are as you expect.

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      
#'   - `"cell"` gives percentages where the denominator is the number of non-missing

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      
#'        rows in the source data frame.

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    
                    
                      
#' - a data frame. Any columns in the data frame that overlap with the `by`/`strata`

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      
#'   columns will be used to calculate the new `"N"`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      
#' - an integer. This single integer will be used as the new `"N"`

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    
                    
                      
#' - a structured data frame. The data frame will include columns from `by`/`strata`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    
                    
                      
#'   The last column must be named `"...ard_N..."`. The integers in this column will

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      
#'   be used as the updated `"N"` in the calculations.

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    
                    
                      
#' When the `p` statistic is returned, the proportion is returned---bounded by `[0, 1]`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    
                    
                      
#' The default function to format the statistic scales the proportion by 100

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    
                    
                      
#' and the percentage is returned which matches the default statistic label of `'%'`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    
                    
                      
#' To get the formatted values, pass the ARD to `apply_fmt_fun()`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    
                    
                      
#' @section Other Statistics:

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    
                    
                      
#' In some cases, you may need other kinds of statistics for categorical variables.

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    
                    
                      
#' Despite the name, `ard_continuous()` can be used to obtain these statistics.

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    
                    
                      
#' In the example below, we calculate the mode of a categorical variable.

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    
                    
                      
#' ```{r}

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    
                    
                      
#' get_mode <- function(x) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    
                    
                      
#'   table(x) |> sort(decreasing = TRUE) |> names() |> getElement(1L)

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    
                    
                      
#' }

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    
                    
                      
#' ADSL |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    
                    
                      
#'   ard_continuous(

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    
                    
                      
#'     variables = AGEGR1,

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    
                    
                      
#'     statistic = list(AGEGR1 = list(mode = get_mode))

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    
                    
                      
#'   )

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    
                    
                      
#' ```

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    
                    
                      
#' @return an ARD data frame of class 'card'

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    
                    
                      
#' @name ard_categorical

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    
                    
                      
#' ard_categorical(ADSL, by = "ARM", variables = "AGEGR1")

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    
                    
                      
#' ADSL |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    
                    
                      
#'   dplyr::group_by(ARM) |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    
                    
                      
#'   ard_categorical(

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    
                    
                      
#'     variables = "AGEGR1",

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    
                    
                      
#'     statistic = everything() ~ "n"

                    		
                  

                  

                    99
                    
                    
                      
#'   )

                    		
                  

                  

                    100
                    
                    
                      
NULL

                    		
                  

                  

                    101
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    102
                    
                    
                      
#' @rdname ard_categorical

                    		
                  

                  

                    103
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    104
                    
                    
                      
ard_categorical <- function(data, ...) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    105
                    414x
                    
                      
  check_not_missing(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    106
                    414x
                    
                      
  UseMethod("ard_categorical")

                    		
                  

                  

                    107
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    108
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    109
                    
                    
                      
#' @rdname ard_categorical

                    		
                  

                  

                    110
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    111
                    
                    
                      
ard_categorical.data.frame <- function(data,

                    		
                  

                  

                    112
                    
                    
                      
                                       variables,

                    		
                  

                  

                    113
                    
                    
                      
                                       by = dplyr::group_vars(data),

                    		
                  

                  

                    114
                    
                    
                      
                                       strata = NULL,

                    		
                  

                  

                    115
                    
                    
                      
                                       statistic = everything() ~ c("n", "p", "N"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    116
                    
                    
                      
                                       denominator = "column",

                    		
                  

                  

                    117
                    
                    
                      
                                       fmt_fun = NULL,

                    		
                  

                  

                    118
                    
                    
                      
                                       stat_label = everything() ~ default_stat_labels(),

                    		
                  

                  

                    119
                    
                    
                      
                                       fmt_fn = deprecated(),

                    		
                  

                  

                    120
                    
                    
                      
                                       ...) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    121
                    414x
                    
                      
  set_cli_abort_call()

                    		
                  

                  

                    122
                    414x
                    
                      
  check_dots_used()

                    		
                  

                  

                    123
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    124
                    
                    
                      
  # deprecated args ------------------------------------------------------------

                    		
                  

                  

                    125
                    414x
                    
                      
  if (lifecycle::is_present(fmt_fn)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    126
                    !
                    
                      
    lifecycle::deprecate_soft(

                    		
                  

                  

                    127
                    !
                    
                      
      when = "0.6.1",

                    		
                  

                  

                    128
                    !
                    
                      
      what = "ard_categorical(fmt_fn)",

                    		
                  

                  

                    129
                    !
                    
                      
      with = "ard_categorical(fmt_fun)"

                    		
                  

                  

                    130
                    
                    
                      
    )

                    		
                  

                  

                    131
                    !
                    
                      
    fmt_fun <- fmt_fn

                    		
                  

                  

                    132
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    133
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    134
                    
                    
                      
  # check inputs ---------------------------------------------------------------

                    		
                  

                  

                    135
                    414x
                    
                      
  check_not_missing(variables)

                    		
                  

                  

                    136
                    414x
                    
                      
  .check_no_ard_columns(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    137
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    138
                    
                    
                      
  # process arguments ----------------------------------------------------------

                    		
                  

                  

                    139
                    414x
                    
                      
  process_selectors(

                    		
                  

                  

                    140
                    414x
                    
                      
    data,

                    		
                  

                  

                    141
                    414x
                    
                      
    variables = {{ variables }},

                    		
                  

                  

                    142
                    414x
                    
                      
    by = {{ by }},

                    		
                  

                  

                    143
                    414x
                    
                      
    strata = {{ strata }}

                    		
                  

                  

                    144
                    
                    
                      
  )

                    		
                  

                  

                    145
                    414x
                    
                      
  data <- dplyr::ungroup(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    146
                    414x
                    
                      
  .check_whether_na_counts(data[variables])

                    		
                  

                  

                    147
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    148
                    413x
                    
                      
  process_formula_selectors(

                    		
                  

                  

                    149
                    413x
                    
                      
    data[variables],

                    		
                  

                  

                    150
                    413x
                    
                      
    statistic = statistic,

                    		
                  

                  

                    151
                    413x
                    
                      
    stat_label = stat_label,

                    		
                  

                  

                    152
                    413x
                    
                      
    fmt_fun = fmt_fun

                    		
                  

                  

                    153
                    
                    
                      
  )

                    		
                  

                  

                    154
                    413x
                    
                      
  fill_formula_selectors(

                    		
                  

                  

                    155
                    413x
                    
                      
    data[variables],

                    		
                  

                  

                    156
                    413x
                    
                      
    statistic = formals(asNamespace("cards")[["ard_categorical.data.frame"]])[["statistic"]] |> eval()

                    		
                  

                  

                    157
                    
                    
                      
  )

                    		
                  

                  

                    158
                    413x
                    
                      
  check_list_elements(

                    		
                  

                  

                    159
                    413x
                    
                      
    x = statistic,

                    		
                  

                  

                    160
                    413x
                    
                      
    predicate = \(x) is.character(x) && all(x %in% c("n", "p", "N", "n_cum", "p_cum")),

                    		
                  

                  

                    161
                    413x
                    
                      
    error_msg = "Elements passed in the {.arg statistic} argument must be one or more of {.val {c('n', 'p', 'N', 'n_cum', 'p_cum')}}"

                    		
                  

                  

                    162
                    
                    
                      
  )

                    		
                  

                  

                    163
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    164
                    
                    
                      
  # return empty ARD if no variables selected ----------------------------------

                    		
                  

                  

                    165
                    413x
